Ryze in his latest iteration (by that I mean, after the introduction of his team teleport R and defined combo mechanics in his QWE), his problems have always been his double-scaling making him do too much damage, and his R being too much of a wild card if it's in any viable state.

So logically speaking, Riot should've tackled those 2 elements to fix him, right? WRONG.

Riot touched just about everything apart from those 2 problematic components, which they're determined to keep them good for some reason.

You'd think after what, 7 reworks or something, Riot should've learned the lesson now that Ryze's problem centers on his double-scaling and later, his ulti. But I guess not. They'd rather keep on over-committing resource on a single champion dancing around the problem than simply fix the obvious.

Almost every skill in the game has a slight delay between when you hit the button and when the skill goes off called a cast time (or at least I call it that). If you are hit by a CC during this time your skill still goes off, even if you can't start using that skill after you get hit by them.

Also, because it takes time for the server to receive inputs from everyone and then send what happened to all of the players there can be slight discrepancies between what you see and what actually happens because the game is trying to predict what will happen in a few milliseconds.

Yi's cast time on his Q was recently removed for being too confusing to his players on top of the already disorientating "I was in Alpha" bug that's in all untargetability spells. The move was made more or less in acknowledgement of the "I was in Alpha" problem in attempt to reduce Yi players' frustration that they feel like they're often getting hit when they shouldn't (as it used to be that Yi players often get hit during the completely unconveyed cast time that many don't even know the existence of, as well as the bug that hits through untargetability; and if they get CC'ed during cast time his Q would still go off but Yi would finish Q while already in the state of being CC'ed and then die instantly which many player may perceive as a sudden lost control of their character).

In this case that Yi's Q now goes off instantly, Yi casting Q after being stunned has to either be a bug, or the guy who proclaims it either was seeing things or they lied and it never happened.
